item.title: Working with Aggregated Data - Common Pitfalls
item.description: As analysts, we oftentimes make the mistake of diving straight into building reports without fully appreciating the data that is given to us. We often fall into pitfalls as a result, embarrassing ourselves with analyses that others are quick to point out has errors. There are many scenarios where this plays out but I am here to talk about working with aggregated data. Firstly, what is aggregated data? TODO: Scrape data from here https://en.

item.title: From PDF to Data Frame in R
item.description: There are instances where you make a data request and you receive data in a PDF. Naturally, this presents a problem - how do you load it into R? As a simple example, I was interested in getting some data on Uganda’s education system. The data I was able to find was on Uganda’s USE and UPOLET ENLORMENT by Local Government / District that can be found here. As a bit of a background on the acronyms:
